**Frame-by-Frame Analysis**  
• **Frame 1:** The camera faces a signalized intersection at dusk. Ahead (straight ahead of the “ego” vehicle) is a two‐lane roadway. On the far right side of the intersection, there is a vertical rectangular sign; though partially obscured, it appears white with black lettering.  
• **Frames 2 & 3:** The same sign on the near‐right corner becomes a bit clearer. The top half of the sign seems to show “30,” consistent with a standard speed limit sign design (white sign, black numbers).  
• **Frame 4:** The sign is more noticeable; it has the general proportions of a typical speed limit sign. “30” is discernible as the posted speed.   
• **Frame 5:** From this final angle, the “30” sign is plainly visible (albeit still partially blocked by a turning vehicle), confirming that it is indeed a speed limit sign, not a temporary or other road marking sign.  

**Contextual Reasoning**  
Across frames, the sign’s shape and placement (right side at an intersection) are consistent with a permanent regulatory speed limit sign. No other speed limit signs are visible contradicting it, and nothing suggests a school zone or special condition that might override 30 mph.  

**Match to Answer Choices**  
• A (25) – Nothing indicates a 25 mph school or residential zone.  
• B (30) – Matches the posted numerical sign visible in multiple frames.  
• C (35) – Not supported by the apparent posted sign.  
• D (40) – Also not supported by evidence in the frames.  

**Provide the Best Answer**  
Based on the clearly visible “30” on the regulatory sign (Frames 2–5), the correct choice is:  

<answer>30</answer>
